reviews.text: Prometheus may not be a satisfying prequel, but it more than makes up for it by being a fascinating sci fi film to unpack.
reviews.author: Justin Kim

reviews.text: [Ridley] showcases his directorial prowess of masterfully building up the tension before evolving into a full-blown terror, coupled with Marc Streitensfeld’s riveting score and Dariusz Wolski’s stunning cinematography.
reviews.author: Casey Chong

reviews.text: It's not without its narrative stumbles, yet it's still impressive to see how Scott can return to the franchise and show how he is happy to challenge himself by exploring new avenues as opposed to resting on his laurels.
reviews.author: Patrick Cavanaugh

reviews.text: Prometheus asks a lot of questions that it refuses to answer, but if you're wiling to go along this philosophical ride there's plenty to enjoy.
reviews.author: Trace Thurman

reviews.text: Ambitious to a fault, Scott's return to the beloved franchise is as philosophical as it is messy. Smart scientists make dumb decisions, yes, but the film is gorgeous, intriguing in its heady ideas, and features a solid Ripley combo in Vickers & Shaw
reviews.author: Joe Lipsett

reviews.text: At its most ambitious, 'Prometheus' plants suggestions of the extraterrestrial origins of life on Earth, a Godlike race sowing genetic seeds across galaxy, and even an Old Testament-like sense of retribution...
reviews.author: Sean Axmaker

reviews.text: The flaws in the screenplay undo even Ridley Scott’s profound level of visual brilliance, which is on considerable display here.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: It’s a visual delight with a story that delivers genuine intensity, some great characters, and an ending that had me howling for more.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: An Alien story without Xenomorphs allows Prometheus to explore the horrors beyond and within our galaxy.
reviews.author: Alan French

reviews.text: You can see the film that could have been made off somewhere in the distance, but you cannot reach it because somebody built this replacement in its way.
reviews.author: Grant Watson

reviews.text: The ideas are big, bold and brutal.
reviews.author: Cory Woodroof

reviews.text: Dazzles from start to finish.
reviews.author: Kip Mooney

reviews.text: A mess of unresolved ideas and poorly defined beings.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: A beautiful film to behold.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: It is as if it were a science fiction theory that bets on an ingenious and interesting mythology, but at the same time, enigmatic. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: The ultimate effectiveness of Prometheus for individual viewers will most likely come down to whether the film carries them away to new places, as it did for me...
reviews.author: Ed Travis

reviews.text: Ridley Scott's return to the universe of ALIEN is slightly undone by blockbuster movie logic and a rather shonky, at times appalling, script.
reviews.author: Jim Ross

reviews.text: Overall, Prometheus is enjoyable as a summer blockbuster but it does not offer enough to compliment the Alien franchise.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: So is this the film of the year? My epiphany in the cinema? No, because "Prometheus" is not exactly flawless. There are some crazy stupid moments in the film.
reviews.author: Ard Vijn

reviews.text: Between the trippy visuals and strong characters, Scott spins an engrossing yarn. But the story is as messy and convoluted as the serpentine creatures that inevitably uncoil from the alien crypt.
reviews.author: Brian D. Johnson

reviews.text: A fascinating journey, to be sure, but its mix of big ideas with horror and suspense never quite meshes together.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.text: A magical bit of science fiction that Scott uses to start widening the world he began in 1979 with Alien.
reviews.author: C.H. Newell

reviews.text: This is a well-crafted piece of work that astutely balances science fiction with some genuinely jump-out-of-your-seat moments. It's a throwback that should please fans of the sci-fi genre.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: Prometheus is a hard one to judge, despite what people had been telling me for years, it's actually not that bad... nor is it that great either. Average it is then!
reviews.author: David Hogan

reviews.text: Even when its reach doesn't quite meet its grasp, it still deserves to be seen.
reviews.author: Zaki Hasan

reviews.text: The plot has a lot of very intriguing concepts and the writers and Scott have come up with a myriad of ways to organically integrate much of the beloved Alien iconography while still forging glorious new images.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: Fans of Scott's previous sci-fi efforts will be desperately disappointed to discover a film which promises an innumerable degree of far more enticing themes and ideas than it can ultimately deliver.
reviews.author: Patrick Gamble

reviews.text: Played with an understated sense of humor by Fassbender, [David's] one of the most entrancing creations on the big screen this year.
reviews.author: Kelly Jane Torrance

reviews.text: This movie is smart, suspenseful and at times, even funny-and the acting is impeccable.
reviews.author: Debbie Baldwin

reviews.text: Prometheus is one of those big ruined films that are worth talking about in terms of how it got ruined, and how it might've been saved.
reviews.author: Eileen Jones

reviews.text: The film is first and foremost a well-made, immersive piece of sci-fi/horror that serves as a perfect addition to Scott's other black space classic.
reviews.author: Johnny Gayzmonic

reviews.text: Viewers with short attention spans probably won't enjoy the gradual build Scott does so well, but it's worth the wait.
reviews.author: Sarah Gopaul

reviews.text: The passage of time brings [Ridley Scott] back to the genre with the questions of a man facing his mortality-and with the tricks of a showman who hasn't forgotten how to scare you.
reviews.author: Pat Padua

reviews.text: Despite its flaws, Prometheus is a visually stunning film (well worth the extra expense of 3-D) that leaves the viewer pondering its themes of creation's longing to know its creator long after the credits have rolled.
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: What is absolutely guaranteed, however, is that Prometheus will entertain you. It's a damn good ride, and it will, occasionally, make you think.
reviews.author: Annalee Newitz

reviews.text: Director Ridley Scott is returning to his roots here, making the kind of atmospheric horror that builds up to its scare through judicious use of music, lighting and setting to set moods, and then punctuating scenes with explosive, frightening violence.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: Prometheus recaptures the essence of not only a beloved franchise, but also an admired yet complicated genre many filmmakers attempt but few successfully. In short, it shows the amateurs how it's really done.
reviews.author: Candice Frederick

reviews.text: A movie like Prometheus-and that is the extraordinary power of its genre-serves as an outlet for irrational connections.
reviews.author: Geoffrey O'Brien

reviews.text: It leads you expect much more than is actually delivered.
reviews.author: Dorothy Woodend

reviews.text: Scott's long-awaited return to science fiction is equal parts wondrous, frustrating and flawed.
reviews.author: Garth Franklin

reviews.text: Even if the movie's logic ultimately spirals down into a vortex of hysteria, horror and hokum, I enjoyed the bulldozer intensity of the climax, which barely keeps a lid on the crackpot cult movie that's wrestling for the soul of this... blockbuster.
reviews.author: Tom Charity

reviews.text: Prometheus is a mesmerising collision of theological angst, going further than Alien in beating on HP Lovecraft's tentacle doorknocker.
reviews.author: James Hoare

reviews.text: Prometheus is so visually ravishing with stunning special effects... But the characterizations are thin and one-note, leaving most of its talented cast members without much interesting to say or do before they get [killed].
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: Prometheus is undeniably gorgeous. It's hard to imagine anything looking better, especially with its brilliant 3-D that's well worth the upsell.
reviews.author: Christopher Lawrence

reviews.text: With poise and great artistry, Scott crafts a world that combines high-tech science, primal beginnings, human frailty and sheer horror.
reviews.author: Dwight Brown

reviews.text: The story is a lurching carnival of budget blasts.
reviews.author: David Elliott

reviews.text: Scott tries not to remake Alien and attempts instead a mini-Kubrick, a muddled Tarkovsky, perhaps an Asimov, or even the recently-departed Bradbury. But old habits, and slimy beings, die hard.
reviews.author: Kong Rithdee

reviews.text: The best-looking stupid movie I've seen all year. It's sumptuously photographed, and often inane.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: Many walked into this movie expecting a science fiction thriller in the vein of Ridley Scott's original Alien. This, I feel, was a colossal mistake.
reviews.author: Chris Stuckmann

reviews.text: It is easily the most cerebral endeavor of its kind since "Minority Report."
reviews.author: David Keyes

reviews.text: Prometheus is scary only in the sum of instincts and talent for movie-making that have been lost.
reviews.author: David Thomson

reviews.text: Any lack in originality is handsomely compensated by the plethora of 3D visual treats courtesy of a crackerjack technical crew that creates an eerie interplanetary moonscape that's as epic as it is requisitely foreboding.
reviews.author: Al Alexander

reviews.text: WPrometheus offers hypotheses about the origin of life on our planet that are so well constructed, they make real-life theories about extraterrestrials seem highly feasible.
reviews.author: Matt Kelemen

reviews.text: The mishmash of grotesque body-horror and chin-stroking existentialism does not always make for the most coherent movie, but it is at least an entertaining one and certainly no black mark on the franchise.
reviews.author: Ali Gray

reviews.text: Rather than trying to reinvent the franchise with new tricks, "Prometheus" wants to return us to that uncertain terror that loomed over the 1979 original.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: Prometheus, as both a response to Alien and its own attempts at philosophical and spiritual investigations, ended up filling in holes that simply were not mandatory to have filled.
reviews.author: Jason Gorber

reviews.text: The movie wasn't giving my brain much of a workout, but my eyes got a nice buzz. "Prometheus" is straight-up gorgeous...
reviews.author: Rob Gonsalves

reviews.text: Insulting lip service to 2001 notwithstanding, Prometheus shocks and awes with more than sufficient technical bravura. If only it was as smart as it clearly thinks it is.
reviews.author: Rob Humanick

reviews.text: Artfully designed with special effects that border on the elegant-there's no other way to put it-"Prometheus" is a visual delight.
reviews.author: James Plath

reviews.text: There's a lot of college dorm philosophical mumbo jumbo on top but it all really boils down to, "Man seeks his creator/makes contact/discovers he is a total jerk."
reviews.author: Brian Holcomb

reviews.text: Prometheus is a welcome return to form for Ridley Scott -- delivering a fascinating sci-fi storyline, gorgeous 3D visuals, and competent filmmaking choices.
reviews.author: Ben Kendrick

reviews.text: Very few films can create a genuine sense of wonder and discovery, and Prometheus manages it for its entire 124 minute running time ... almost entirely a sensory experience.
reviews.author: Adam Ross

reviews.text: Never quite matching Alien or Aliens for emotional authenticity - but definitely holding you in tow until the final moments. Ridley Scott isn't much for illustrating humanity, but he sure as hell knows how to craft aliens.
reviews.author: Patrick Kolan

reviews.text: Prometheus might have given serous thought to this premise, but it opts instead for strenuous action. Still, the film has glimmerings of intelligence.
reviews.author: David Sterritt

reviews.text: It isn't perfect, but Prometheus is a thoroughly entertaining summer blockbuster that is a cut above the rest due to an amazing cast and Ridley Scott, who re-establishes himself as one of our greatest world building filmmakers.
reviews.author: Will Chadwick

reviews.text: The film [has] a kind of "been there, done that" feeling.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: Returning to the genre that skyrocketed his career with "Alien" and "Blade Runner," Scott has fashioned a fascinating new mystery within his original "Alien" universe.
reviews.author: Justin Craig

reviews.text: Scott has lensed a film that possesses the look of a video View-Master. It's jaw-droppingly striking.
reviews.author: Erick Weber

reviews.text: I won't say that I'm con-metheus, but I'm not entirely pro-metheus either.
reviews.author: William Bibbiani

reviews.text: An excellent film, but not quite the genre-redefining, mind-blowing, life-changing experience much of the hype suggests.
reviews.author: Rick Marshall

reviews.text: In space, everyone can hear you try too hard.
reviews.author: Eric Henderson

reviews.text: Scott has indeed created another sci-fi classic -- brilliant mess that it is.
reviews.author: Richard Knight

reviews.text: "Prometheus" comes off as a really fun movie with knockout effects, a splendid visual design, tense scenes, a playful attitude but ... well, it's a wee bit familiar.
reviews.author: Kirk Honeycutt

reviews.text: Ridley Scott retells an old story
reviews.author: Marty Mapes

reviews.text: After a stunning opening, Scott fails to close the deal
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: Prometheus asks a big, loaded question, but teasingly leaves the answer for another mission...and another movie.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: For those who aren't opposed to a little 'Why?' in their sci-fi, Ridley offers a penetrating other-worldly adventure like few films in recent memory.
reviews.author: Bruce Bennett

reviews.text: Ridley Scott's long-awaited prequel-of-sorts to his game-changing 1979 classic sci-fi terror ride Alien is not only conceptually lame and badly made, it's actually worse than Alien Resurrection.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: Let's get this straight: 'Prometheus' is not a direct prequel to 'Alien,' 'Aliens' or 'Predator.' However, 'Prometheus' does exist in that particular universe.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: The movie may be a scare show that leaves many questions unanswered, but Scott's craft earns an exhausted kind of respect.
reviews.author: David Denby

reviews.text: The production design by Arthur Max and the art direction of the film are spectacular. It is an awesome feat of visual art.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: They would have been better off channeling their inner Ellen Ripley and pulling the release to the airlock before this voyage departed.
reviews.author: Scott Wold

reviews.text: While I was completely engrossed in 'Prometheus', I felt a tug-of-war going on between the cerebral and visceral elements, right up to the finale.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: With a few perfectly pitched sequences of sheer terror -- capped by an astonishing surgery scene featuring Rapace -- Scott coils the tension to unbearable tightness.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: Scott was so intent on returning his spawn to glory that he mistakenly shot for Alien by way of 2001: A Space Odyssey, making it all the more disappointing when he inevitably settled for Aliens by way of Lost in Space.
reviews.author: Jordan Hiller

reviews.text: The movie has good acting and a great look, but the plot is confusing and eventually not as interesting as it should be.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: 'Prometheus' could be starting something great. While it looks amazing, the jury is out on whether it ends up reminding me of 'The Matrix Reloaded' more than anything else.
reviews.author: Jeff Bayer

reviews.text: a would-be summer blockbuster of intense ambition and visual grandeur, merging metaphysical speculation with healthy doses of gooey-horrific imagery and high-tension suspense
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: Starts out intriguingly as an exploration of faith and humankind's origins. To my disappointment, though, it largely abandons this once the familiar face-huggers and chest-bursters start to appear.
reviews.author: Fr. Chris Carpenter

reviews.text: It's a striking composition that's burdened by frustrating unanswered questions that distract from the greater themes of faith and religion in science.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: It's a gutsy effort but the screenplay from Jon Spaihts and Damon Lindelof isn't strong enough. I was struggling with the characters from the very beginning.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: It's not necessarily a bad movie, it's just half of a great one. And that's almost more disappointing.
reviews.author: Anders Wotzke

reviews.text: For all its grand designs and sweeping vistas, Prometheus could simply do with a bit more story.
reviews.author: Ed Gibbs

reviews.text: It's like going to the Dalai Lama with a question only for him to answer you with a question.
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: If this film wasn't burdened with having to serve as a prequel to the 'Alien' series, it would be much stronger overall.
reviews.author: Drew McWeeny

reviews.text: The premise that creatures from outer space "engineered" human life on earth is loaded with cautionary baggage. For one thing, it screams FICTION and FANTASY in a context that strives for the appearance of realism.
reviews.author: Jules Brenner

reviews.text: "Alien" had great characters, unrivaled shocks and a claustrophobic atmosphere. Prometheus ... looks great!
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: Often good and sometimes bad and occasionally horrendous as a narrative, but it is never, ever, less than a stone-cold masterpiece of design and world-building.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: ...a smart, ambitious, and, admittedly, erratically-paced blockbuster that does seem as though it'd benefit from repeat viewings (as well as a more complete picture promised by inevitable followups).
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: "Prometheus" is a cinematic masterpiece with beautifully haunting visuals and an epic score. Instead of spoon-feeding the audience, Scott allows you to think for yourself!
reviews.author: Kevin McCarthy

reviews.text: A hot mess of a screenplay, but extraordinarily ambitious and boasts Ridley Scott's usual arresting visuals.
reviews.author: Christopher Lloyd

reviews.text: Crushed under the weight of its own pretentious ideas.
reviews.author: Richard Edwards

reviews.text: Beneath the overreaching ambition (pretension?) lies a solidly entertaining creature feature of superior style--maybe not exactly the deep existential examination Scott and Lindelof were striving for, but no small feat all the same.
reviews.author: Michael Dequina

reviews.text: A thinly-veiled intro to the Alien franchise revising that classic's tagline to suggest: In space, no one can hear you scream, except perhaps God.
reviews.author: Kam Williams

reviews.text: Talvez Scott devesse ter se preocupado mais em resolver os problemas narrativos da produção do que em deixar pontas soltas que justificassem mais uma continuação.
reviews.author: Pablo Villaça

reviews.text: The tragedy of this Prometheus is that it begins to ask huge questions, and then saves the answers for a sequel.
reviews.author: Rubin Safaya

reviews.text: (The) parent/child and creator/creation themes (are) pretty deep for a film this pretty. What else did you expect from Ridley Scott?
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: Hobbled by a script that largely ignores its marginally implied protagonist, "Prometheus" is a cobbled-together sci-fi movie at odds with itself.
reviews.author: Cole Smithey

reviews.text: If you like grandiose space opera, you'll love "Prometheus," especially in earsplitting, visually overwhelming IMAX.
reviews.author: Duane Dudek

reviews.text: It promises to give us at least science fictional explanations for some of the great questions of human existence, but it never has the courage to answer those questions.
reviews.author: Mark R. Leeper

reviews.text: Its analytical story line is cold and never warms enough to make it less than inert.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: Gorgeous, somewhat baffling, and not altogether unpleasant.
reviews.author: Widgett Walls

reviews.text: In a nutshell, the best thing about Prometheus can be summed up in two words: Michael Fassbender.
reviews.author: Beth Accomando

reviews.text: offers the unalloyed pleasure of fierce, intelligent performances in a piece of commendable speculative fiction told on both an epic and an intimate scale.
reviews.author: Andrea Chase

reviews.text: ... a major disappointment. 'Alien' fans aren't looking for arty sci-fi or answers to 'the most meaningful questions asked by mankind'; they're looking for something primal, like a cattle prod to the back of the neck.
reviews.author: Glenn Lovell

reviews.text: A movie that forces you to be intellectually invested, but not to the point of exhaustion and, in turn, delivers a remarkably enthralling experience.
reviews.author: Perri Nemiroff

reviews.text: Alienation for some, ecstasy for others. Certain to reign as the best disappointment of 2012, Ridley Scott's Prometheus is a work whose visual splendor can't be denied but whose narrative content will divide audiences.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: Tense and thrilling, it's an awesome 3-D spectacle.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: Very cold, analytical, and sort of pretentious. Its no Piranha 3D!
reviews.author: Michelle Alexandria

reviews.text: Rapace is a revelation as a tougher then she seems character who actually "out-Ripleys" Sigourney Weaver's character in "Alien."
reviews.author: Michael A. Smith

reviews.text: It's difficult to discuss the true limitations of the film without exposing a wealth of spoilers, but it seems Ridley Scott has already spoiled enough by returning to the realm of his finest work without a clear exit strategy.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Prometheus provides little new knowledge.
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: "Prometheus" is visually impressive, so much so that it overshadows the shortcomings in the script by Damon Lindelof and Jon Spaihts.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: A spectacular and absorbing -- if not exactly unpredictable -- two hours at the movies.
reviews.author: Kelly Vance

reviews.text: ( ... ) cinema-goers looking for physical, stellar excitement might be left wishing for booster rockets.
reviews.author: Graham Young

reviews.text: a grand space journey along the lines of 2001: A Space Odyssey with teeth and less psychedelic drugs. It is not quite what you'll expect, and it's a better film for it.
reviews.author: Kevin Carr

reviews.text: Noomi Rapace will no longer be referred to as the original Girl with a Dragon Tattoo after her work here.
reviews.author: David Medsker

reviews.text: A visually arresting but thematically drab sci-fi thriller.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: Maybe we came from someone else, maybe we are just living in a giant petri dish, who knows? I had a great time in the theater, I was in this world, and I find myself afterwards asking questions, what more do you want out of a movie than that?
reviews.author: Mark Ellis

reviews.text: You will believe you are on another planet, visually it is fantastic. I wanted to love this movie but I wound up just liking it. That being said, I can't wait for another one
reviews.author: Kristian Harloff

reviews.text: An intense and thought-provoking piece of sci-fi, with enough moments of sheer horror to give audiences a jolt and enough intelligence to keep them thinking afterward.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Regardless of its box office performance, Prometheus has a long life ahead of it.
reviews.author: Rob Vaux

reviews.text: The setup is familiar-the mysterious planet, the slick tunnels, the shocking bodily violation, the broken quarantine, etc. So why is there a gaping hole where the dread should be?
reviews.author: Joshua Rothkopf

reviews.text: Prometheus tells a much bigger story and does it well, but it's missing what matters most. It's inorganic.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: If only the screenwriters engaged our intellect like the filmmaker engages our fears, we would have had a new classic, rather than a beautiful, unfulfilled promise.
reviews.author: Jason Buchanan

reviews.text: There's definite mastery here, but it's hardly a masterpiece.
reviews.author: Rick Groen

reviews.text: Prometheus--like, in its telling, the human race itself--is a creation spliced from the DNA of superior forebears.
reviews.author: Christopher Orr

reviews.text: Gorgeous and pretentious, ridiculous and awesome. 'Where do we come from? What is our purpose? What happens when we die?' -- in space, unfortunately, everyone can hear Guy Pearce channeling Sean Penn in 'The Tree of Life.'
reviews.author: John Beifuss

reviews.text: Much like Rutger Hauer's turn as a replicant in Scott's Blade Runner, Fassbender's performance may launch Prometheus into the cult stratosphere.
reviews.author: Lisa Kennedy

reviews.text: I'll say this much for it -- it's not boring.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: Ridley Scott succeeds in reluming this Promethean heat.
reviews.author: Boo Allen

reviews.text: If you name your movie after the titan in Greek mythology who stole fire from the Gods and shared it with mankind, you'd better cast a lot of light. Prometheus leaves us in the dark.
reviews.author: Lawrence Toppman

reviews.text: Religious neurotics will find plenty of blasphemous ideas to complain about, and yet the question of spiritual belief - the elevation of faith beyond reason - finds substantial support in Prometheus too. Take your pick.
reviews.author: Russell Edwards

reviews.text: The sheer ambition at work throughout Prometheus makes the occasional scripting hiccup a forgivable flaw.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: I was very disappointed. I think it even got to the point of being quite silly.
reviews.author: Margaret Pomeranz

reviews.text: Ridley Scott means to bring wonder and horror back to summertime spectacle, and Prometheus mostly succeeds in that regard. (Mostly.)
reviews.author: William Goss

reviews.text: Prometheus, featuring sumptuous 3-D landscapes and a new Ripley-like protagonist embodied by Noomi Rapace, is an intelligent summer blockbuster.
reviews.author: Lori Hoffman

reviews.text: The suspense and tension keeps you on the edge of your seat. Everyone will come away with their own individualized impressions from experiencing this film. Some may be frustrated by the lack of profound definitive answers and the ambiguity that you're...
reviews.author: Keith Cohen

reviews.text: Where the goal of Alien was to scare the bejesus out of you; Prometheus boasts loftier, 2001-esq ambitions along with trying to creep you right out of your seat.
reviews.author: Mathew DeKinder

reviews.text: I don't mind that Prometheus raises big questions without ultimately answering them...I do mind that [it] has virtually nothing interesting, insightful or thoughtful to say about them.
reviews.author: Steven D. Greydanus

reviews.text: There is no tension. Nothing to get you chewing your nails. You know going in very few characters are coming out. The only suspense is wondering if there will be a part two.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: The "prequel/not prequel" BS is just a way for Lindelof to disguise the fact he either has no idea what he's doing, or no intention of answering the questions he's posed.
reviews.author: Pete Vonder Haar

reviews.text: While the old Scott would have cooked up an ending worthy of his material, the new Scott at least has delivered three-fourths of a great movie.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: It's not a monster movie in the same sense as the original. As the title suggests, the story is more concerned about the right to play God, and the Frankenstein like result of doing same.
reviews.author: Bill Gibron

reviews.text: The fact that Prometheus begins with such confidence and brio makes it all the more disappointing when it becomes clear that Lindelof and Scott haven't thought the movie through.
reviews.author: Ethan Alter

reviews.text: Contains the most electrifying body-horror shock scene in recent memory. But the discursive narrative leeches energy from the film, and it only intermittently approaches this level of graphic power.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: Even though Scott visually dazzles us, the plot is a muddle. And light years away from the DNA of Scott's prior sci-fi films -- neither the thrill of Alien, nor the brilliance of Blade Runner.
reviews.author: Kimberly Gadette

reviews.text: "Prometheus" has the integrity of a serious and sincere attempt, but ultimately it won't please anybody.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: "Prometheus" may go overboard on the existential inquiry, but it's still an epic ride.
reviews.author: Alison Gang

reviews.text: I appreciate a good scare and a good story. Unfortunately, not much of either is present in this script.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: One aspect of the film that can't be denied are its visual accomplishments.
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: An infuriating example of a film that holds huge potential and borders on greatness, but in falling just short of that mark feels little more than mediocre.
reviews.author: Ian Buckwalter

reviews.text: Recycled Ridley Scott is still better than most of the garbage coming out today.
reviews.author: Radheyan Simonpillai

reviews.text: What we have here is less a bad film than a genuinely maddening one, which has sequences of tremendous skill and moments of keen promise. But it's such a mess.
reviews.author: Jason Bailey

reviews.text: For all of the things that are familiar and give you an immediate understanding as to what story you're watching as it unfolds, there's plenty to drink in.
reviews.author: Grae Drake

reviews.text: You don't always get what you think you want, but what you wind up with is still immensely satisfying.
reviews.author: Dave White

reviews.text: Of all the revelations in Ridley Scott's Prometheus, perhaps the most astounding is that Scott doesn't understand his own work.
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: The kind of movie that has you talking about it and dissecting it long after the credits roll.
reviews.author: Scott Chitwood

reviews.text: 'Prometheus' is not so much a prequel to Ridley Scott's 'Alien' as it is a remake. Fortunately, Scott remembers what made his unsettling 1979 classic work.
reviews.author: Dan Lybarger

reviews.text: While Prometheus meets everything required of it to reap rich box office returns, I found it less complex and intellectually stimulating than the promotional clips and videos suggested.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: With its creepy caves and yawning space, "Prometheus" is on one level a somber dialogue between man the aspirant and man the mortal.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: "Prometheus" is genuinely epic.
reviews.author: Tom Long

reviews.text: Visually impressive and featuring one or two breakout performances, this anticlimactic exercise too often plays as though it has been cobbled together from archetypes, imagery and tropes from countless other movies.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: For a movie about something as monumental and controversial as the origins of life, Prometheus intentionally is a muted, very unemotional movie.
reviews.author: Willie Waffle

reviews.text: The movie works despite its collection of characters that you sort of want to die.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: It's a welcome return of a franchise that had been experiencing a steady decline in artistic and box office returns. Just don't go in expecting the quality or total experience of the first two films. (Full Content Review for Parents also available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: It's not Alien, but very, very few films are. It's exciting, extremely well made and mysterious. It's also, at times, very confusing, difficult to follow, and, bizarrely for a Scott film, has a couple of seriously clunky moments.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: The art direction updates the cold, sinister look of Alien  perfectly and the cinematography is beautiful, but actors sometimes have to deliver dialogue that's pretty clunky and obvious.
reviews.author: Eric Melin

reviews.text: This is not a gamechanger. It's a standard Sci-Fi thriller that's done well. I was entertained, but probably would have liked it even more if the hype wasn't so out of control.
reviews.author: Austin Kennedy

reviews.text: What would you ask your maker if you had the chance? Has humanity earned the right to live? Prometheus' first 40 minutes are a banquet of juicy themes, speculations and inquiries that are ultimately left to rot on the table.
reviews.author: Jeff Meyers

reviews.text: Scott never manages to reach that next gear to really make it special. It's competent, but you likely won't feel as if you've just witnessed a modern-day classic by the time the credits roll.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: While I wish I liked this movie a lot more, it simply has too many interesting assets to dismiss outright.
reviews.author: Scott Weinberg

reviews.text: Anybody trying to tell you this is a bad movie is out of their mind...I say this lovingly.
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: A thigh-clenchingly frightening science-fiction epic as well as a ruminative, soul-baring existential study that's not afraid to ask the tough questions.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: Prometheus, as absolutely gorgeous as it is to look at, doesn't quite live up to the hype.
reviews.author: Rebecca Murray

reviews.text: Hopefully, if Scott's previous ventures into the future are any indication, Prometheus will get better with repeat viewings.
reviews.author: Peter Paras

reviews.text: Make no mistake, it takes a lot of money, energy, and anticipation to make a movie this bad.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: Prometheus is more interested in piling on big questions than in answering them. It's deep without being particularly smart, although the dazzling design and special effects keep you from noticing that basic flaw until at least an hour in.
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: Striking CGI, inept narrative.
reviews.author: Harvey S. Karten

reviews.text: When it comes to technical wizardry and sheer visual spectacle, Prometheus unequivocally delivers.
reviews.author: Claudia Puig

reviews.text: If you have fond, 33-year-old memories of averting your young eyes from a propulsive parasite critter, Prometheus might just be your kind of return trip.
reviews.author: Chris Vognar

reviews.text: Maybe Prometheus is deep, after all, with Weyland Corporation standing in for 20th Century Fox in an allegory for Scott's artistic aspirations: funding and undermining his ambitions at the same time.
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: What resonates in Scott's graceful, grownup, pristine film is its majestic mind.
reviews.author: Joe Neumaier

reviews.text: This tale of an interstellar search asks cosmic questions about the meaning of life, but comes up with lame answers in a script that screams attention-deficit disorder.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: As a thriller, it's muddled, and as a Big Ideas movie, it seems to trip over its own double helix.
reviews.author: Gary Thompson

reviews.text: "Prometheus" is breezy and comely and sufficiently clever to mitigate most qualms, and Fassbender, especially, is wonderful.
reviews.author: Shawn Levy

reviews.text: The ending isn't squishy scary or deeply satisfying. Bummer. Otherwise, Prometheus kicks ass so hard and often that it's impossible not to be thrilled by it.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: Dazzling sort-of prequel to Ridley Scott's landmark 1979 sci-fi chiller Alien delivers both remarkable visuals and truly horrific set-pieces.
reviews.author: Kevin Lally

reviews.text: If Scott could somehow have spliced the DNA of the first movie with that of the Kubrickian masterpiece that he just can't shake, then he'd have an Alien that was truly strange.
reviews.author: Peter Keough

reviews.text: One of these stories has been shoehorned into the other, and the result is an incongruous blend of thoughtful science fiction and a grotesque horror sideshow.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: Unlike any of the sequels between it and the original, Prometheus is a horror movie first and foremost, gnawing at subconscious terrors even as your conscious mind attempts to bat it away.
reviews.author: Sam Adams

reviews.text: Master director Ridley Scott creates a riveting ride while Michael Fassbender steals the show.
reviews.author: Clint O'Connor

reviews.text: Narratively, it's a mess. There's a through-line Darwinism vs. creationism thing going on that ping-pongs big religious and philosophical ideas, but whiffs the return.
reviews.author: Steven Rea

reviews.text: I saw Prometheus without my trusty guide-wife next to me to describe the creepy stuff yet watched every second of the movie. And not once did I jump out of my skin.
reviews.author: Richard Corliss

reviews.text: Even though the cliches are overly abundant, it's gratifying to see Ridley Scott once more serving up aliens in style.
reviews.author: Mark Sells

reviews.text: If you keep your expectations reasonable, it's suspenseful and fun.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: A return to frozen fear of what may or may not around the corner, amid big-ish thoughts about where we came from.
reviews.author: Jim Slotek

reviews.text: On balance, the experience of watching "Prometheus" makes up for the movie's flaws, but you'll still spend a lot of time being frustrated.
reviews.author: Loey Lockerby

reviews.text: Making up for the expected nature of some of the film's plot twists is Arthur Max's spooky, H.R. Giger-influenced production design, Dariusz Wolski's fluid cinematography, as well as Scott's moment-to-moment storytelling skill.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: A coolly elegant, tauntly intense contribution to the 'Alien' universe...beautifully crafted and visually striking.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: "Epic" comes in many forms. Prometheus sports all of them.
reviews.author: Matt Patches

reviews.text: With Prometheus, Ridley Scott follows too far behind on the path that he himself paved the way for all those years ago.
reviews.author: Scott A. Mantz

reviews.text: A combo science-fiction horror film and quest drama exploring the origin of our species.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: Visually stunning, wildly ambitious, but ultimately as emotionally involving as the icy core of a dead star.
reviews.author: Marc Savlov

reviews.text: The plot of this Alien prequel was a carefully guarded secret -- so carefully guarded, in fact, that not even the movie reveals it.
reviews.author: J. R. Jones

reviews.text: The good news is that Prometheus is the third best Alien movie after Ridley Scott's original, and James Cameron's Aliens. The bad news is that when you're better than Alien 3 and Alien: Resurrection, that's not much of a compliment.
reviews.author: Todd Gilchrist

reviews.text: God (or Alien) knows this movie is derivative. But as someone else once said, originality isn't everything.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: Prometheus is a prequel that works as a stand-alone but offers added benefits to those familiar with the Alien series.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: Stripped to its visceral essentials, the franchise is meant to frighten us and gross us out, and Prometheus rises to that modest challenge.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: Aping Stanley Kubrick's "2001: A Space Odyssey," Scott and his screenwriters have designed this towering puzzle to provoke debate, with liberal allusions to gender, race and religion.
reviews.author: Joe Williams

reviews.text: Mr. Scott's sense of visual scale, which has often produced hectic, hectoring grandiosity (are you not entertained?), achieves, especially in the first hour, something like genuine grandeur.
reviews.author: A.O. Scott

reviews.text: If you have a dozen engaged and insightful friends who are willing to share a beer after seeing 'Prometheus,' you can talk yourself into thinking it's a fabulous movie.
reviews.author: Jordan Hoffman

reviews.text: In space, no one can hear you having a good time.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: Scott's reboot of the franchise is a technically glorious thing...and Noomi Rapace gives a thoroughly engaging performance as a character quite different from Ripley, but you'll probably enjoy the film a lot more if you've never seen "Alien."
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: This is the kind of bold filmmaking destined to stand the test of time when memories of most of its competitors have long faded away.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: Not only does the film do enough right to warrant a recommendation, even where it goes wrong is in ways that can stimulate thought and provoke interesting conversation.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: Fassbender's David is the film's centerpiece. Rapace plays the Hollywood girlfriend role instead of a steely protagonist on a messianic journey. Theron always commits fully to every character she plays.
reviews.author: Victoria Alexander

reviews.text: Our genre pictures are being burdened by a love of lore.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: So beautiful it belongs on the Maxim Hot 100.
reviews.author: Matt Pais

reviews.text: The not-a-prequel tactic is a failed smoke screen since its strength is the connection to the beginning of a universe. Eliminate it and you are left with just another muddled creature feature with ideas more grandiose than the writers exploring them.
reviews.author: Erik Childress

reviews.text: While its vast sets and production values are simply stunning, "Prometheus" ultimately disappoints.
reviews.author: Soren Andersen

reviews.text: Though Prometheus follows Alien's story beats, it's a looser and less satisfying story, more intellectual than visceral, and not fully satisfying on either level. But in part, that's because it's trying to do so much more.
reviews.author: Tasha Robinson

reviews.text: Ridley Scott's "Prometheus" is a magnificent science-fiction film, all the more intriguing because it raises questions about the origin of human life and doesn't have the answers.
reviews.author: Roger Ebert

reviews.text: Questions go unanswered, shocking occurences go unquestioned, and supposedly intelligent people do stupid things.
reviews.author: Matt Neal

reviews.text: It isn't a profound sci-fi treatise on humanity's place in the universe, but it is an exciting, visually stunning and often exquisitely suspenseful adventure story.
reviews.author: Josh Bell

reviews.text: Watching "Prometheus" is like opening a deluxe gift box from Tiffany's to find a mug from the dollar store.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: "Prometheus" damn near lives up to the unsustainable hype, at least at the level of cinematography, production design, special effects and pure wow factor.
reviews.author: Andrew O'Hehir

reviews.text: Has enough tension and jolts to the system to make it well worth seeing.
reviews.author: David Stratton

reviews.text: The list of the film's bad choices is as long as it was short in the original.
reviews.author: Paul Byrnes

reviews.text: After an encouraging start the film too hastily descends into a contrived jumble of fiction, burdened by undertows of faith, mankind's origins and what it means to be human.
reviews.author: Brad Gray

reviews.text: It's an impressive accomplishment, but one that is destined to leave some with un-met expectations.
reviews.author: Glenn Dunks

reviews.text: Prometheus elicits Alien memories for viewers who have them, but works on its own, too, as a model of a contemporary (and, as is the contempo mode, long-winded) sci-fi horror pic.
reviews.author: Lisa Schwarzbaum

reviews.text: "Prometheus" repeats many past glories, and its plot is squishy nonsense. But its grand sets and intricate effects are dazzling, and in at least one scene, Scott almost manages to top himself.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: You're more likely to enjoy the film if you go in thinking less about "Alien" and more about Scott, with his emphasis on images, tone and atmosphere over -- sometimes at the expense of -- plot and story.
reviews.author: Bill Goodykoontz

reviews.text: Why are we here? What is our purpose? Is there a God? When does this movie get good?
reviews.author: Rene Rodriguez

reviews.text: A fantastic film that really should be accepted on its own merits as science fiction filmmaking at its finest.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: Scott briskly blends the high-minded stuff with impressive boo-and-goo sequences, ratcheting tension in tight spots and dark caverns. One set piece should become a new milestone in horror, as John Hurt's tummy trouble did in Alien.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: Like "Alien," the new movie derives its appeal not only from stunning, otherworldly imagery but also from the central performances tasked with reacting to it.
reviews.author: Eric Kohn

reviews.text: This is a remarkably scary and eye-popping headrush of a movie, an experience that offers a maximum adrenaline boost at the same time as it engages your intelligence. Don't miss it.
reviews.author: Glenn Kenny

reviews.text: Prometheus stirs the suspicion that the creators are no wiser than the audience about what all the scattergun clues and symbols actually add up to.
reviews.author: Hannah McGill

reviews.text: The one thing that stands out for me in Prometheus is the suggestion that mankind's origins are not benign: we are made by violent, destructive forces ... in their own image
reviews.author: Andrew L. Urban

reviews.text: The astonishing creature designs of H.R. Giger are the stars of Ridley Scott's highly awaited sci-fi thriller that spews horror when you least expect it
reviews.author: Louise Keller

reviews.text: The ideas it unlocks ultimately are more intriguing than the movie itself. In other words, it's a movie that's more fun to think about afterward than it is to sit through.
reviews.author: Marshall Fine

reviews.text: There's nothing here to match the visceral shock in Alien of seeing John Hurt's chest explode but Scott does deliver a grisly standout scene that exploits the series' recurring themes of body horror and fear of birth
reviews.author: Jason Best

reviews.text: Prometheus seems to delusionally maintain that its modest thrills are being enlivened by deeper concerns.
reviews.author: John Semley

reviews.text: With this overreaching Prometheus, Scott seems a bit like David carefully arranging his hair in imitation of O'Toole's Lawrence. He can still mimic the appearance of an epic, noble, important movie -- but the appearance is all.
reviews.author: Nick Pinkerton

reviews.text: Big and overcomplicated is so often mistaken for better, when really it's only...big and overcomplicated.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: There's no denying that Prometheus will make for a perfectly entertaining night at the movies -- but we were promised so much more.
reviews.author: Tom Huddleston

reviews.text: For all the noise and thunder early on, Prometheus just runs out of steam, but what a ride until it does.
reviews.author: Joshua Starnes

reviews.text: It's aiming to be both an epic space thriller and a spiritual treatise, and watching it almost accomplish both makes it all the more frustrating.
reviews.author: Katey Rich

reviews.text: ...a science fiction film that will leave fans arguing, with some dismissing it out of hand and others declaring it a modern masterpiece.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: In space no one can hear PROMETHEUS disappoint you.
reviews.author: Devin Faraci

reviews.text: I think the thing I like most about this film is that it will spark many, many interesting conversations. So many people will have so many takes on the film and I am really looking forward to joining the debates.
reviews.author: Danny Minton

reviews.text: [W]ant[s] to be... ambitious SF drama. [But] somewhere along the way, the provocative speculation and the seriocomic tragedy got lost. Oh, and the characters got forgotten, too. Plus there's precious little authentic drama.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: I wish more films had this level of ambition, along with the artistry to execute it.
reviews.author: Dominic Corry

reviews.text: The paranoia becomes palpable, and a lot of its impact comes from how dramatic and dazzlingly seamless the special effects are.
reviews.author: Christy Lemire

reviews.text: Alien DNA plays a big role in Prometheus, but it's the DNA of Alien that this new movie just can't quite live up to. The less you think of this new film as part of that legendary series, the more you'll enjoy it.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: The film is utterly gorgeous to look at. Every exterior and interior shot looks like a painting, rendered in thick, velvety strokes. The CGI is entirely seamless, and, indeed, minimal considering the subject matter.
reviews.author: Paul Verhoeven

reviews.text: After delivering a brilliant first half, its ambition seems to exceed its execution, but despite becoming muddled, it remains a visually stunning and wild cinematic ride.
reviews.author: Anthony O'Connor

reviews.text: A more elegant and thoughtful sci-fi film than we've gotten in many a year. The 3D is truly immersive, the scares well-earned, and the performances top-notch.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: If you were hoping for deep, dark visuals by Scott in 3D...or a goth take on 2001 and 2010 combined, this delivers. If you wanted a more James Cameron-style action movie, it doesn't.
reviews.author: Luke Y. Thompson

reviews.text: The film doesn't finish its meal before moving onto dessert; abandoning a satisfying conclusion in favour of starting work on the inevitable sequel. Naughty Hollywood! Eat your greens!
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: It's great to see Scott back in the realm of sci-fi but it's a superficial attempt to brand something new with the familiar elements of Alien
reviews.author: Cameron Williams

reviews.text: Prometheus is a strongly acted, superbly designed movie, an exciting and at times emetic experience. Some surprises might have been anticipated with a little thought, others not.
reviews.author: Philip French

reviews.text: Prometheus is a visual triumph and if nothing else it deserves credit for the moments when it does evoke the early scenes in Alien with the same degree of sinister wonder.
reviews.author: Thomas Caldwell

reviews.text: Prometheus is atmospherically dazzling in a way that makes your eyeballs want to have a cigarette, zip up their pants and go out for breakfast afterwards.
reviews.author: Luke Buckmaster

reviews.text: It's all a bit woolly-minded. Shock horror indeed.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: With a stuttering story, some elements of the narrative struggle to hit home but Prometheus is still generally a success.
reviews.author: Sam Bathe

reviews.text: Prometheus is anticlimactic and terribly uneven: superbly staged scenes give way to cliches and seemingly reasonable characters end up doing things that defy any kind of believable motivation.
reviews.author: Nick Dent

reviews.text: Beneath the hype and promises, however, it's almost a letdown that the actual film is merely very good: a better-than-average 3D big-budget space tale.
reviews.author: James Rocchi

reviews.text: In space, no one can hear your disappointment.
reviews.author: Tom Clift

reviews.text: The fact that the movie was able to recycle the plot of Star Trek V will likely never get the level of praise it deserves.
reviews.author: Joshua Tyler

reviews.text: 'Prometheus' is a visually striking sci-fi epic that delivers an incredible sense of awe mixed with breathtaking visual effects.
reviews.author: Brad Miska

reviews.text: The deep, dark shadows that played such a crucial role in the shot-on-film Alien and its sequels are gone in Prometheus.
reviews.author: Simon Foster

reviews.text: Prometheus is proto-product placement film - where the product is Alien. The philosophical sojourn, the stirring performances by Fassbender and Rapace, and the sublime aesthetic are severely inhibited by the nods to the Alien mythos.
reviews.author: Blake Howard

reviews.text: In the end, the Prometheus plot is slightly bonkers, but forgivably so, because the characters are so well drawn. And there are enough slime bursts to make Ghostbusters look timid.
reviews.author: Kate Muir

reviews.text: The well-paced and perfectly structured plot are matched by solid performances and powerfully arresting visuals.
reviews.author: Terry Staunton

reviews.text: There are some intriguing ideas embedded within the script - Darwinism vs Creationism, the recklessness of scientific endeavour - but inevitably, Scott's film reduces to a big budget game of cat and mouse.
Prometheus isn't a classic, unlike Alien and Blade Runner, but there are enough quality ingredients to make me hope Scott gets the money to make the sequel.
reviews.author: Christopher Tookey

reviews.text: Prometheus suffers from a near-terminal inability to decide what story it wants to tell.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: Ridley coaxes out some memorable performances from Rapace and Fassbender, and keeps a consistent sense of man's curiosity at the bigger evolution picture... The rest is open to interpretation.
reviews.author: Lisa Giles-Keddie

reviews.text: "The keen fan," Scott has said, "will recognise strands of Alien's DNA." The keen fan will be regularly concussed by these strands.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: The nonsense logic rather undermines the portentous tone of the whole thing but luckily, after a rather laboured first hour, the picture gets on with the business of scaring us.
reviews.author: Henry Fitzherbert

reviews.text: While it lacks Alien's ferocious simplicity and focus, Scott's determination to see his often loopy ideas through gives his film a single-minded vigour rarely found in pictures of this scale.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: An awe-inspiring, mind-gouging, eye-blazing spectacle of high-pitched disappointment.
reviews.author: Matt Bochenski

reviews.text: An enjoyable, if flawed sci-fi thriller that's worth seeing for Fassbot and Noomi Rapace.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: Even if the plot is full of holes, it's utterly mesmerising.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Scott's Alien prequel falls short in philosophical ambitions and characterization, but in visual imagery and mood, it's a thrilling, haunting, awesome spectacle likley to become a cult phenom.
reviews.author: Emanuel Levy

reviews.text: Scott's most well-rounded and accomplished feature since his classic Blade Runner thirty years ago. Seek it out for yourself and again remember that imaginative, daring sci-fi is out there for the finding.
reviews.author: Shaun Munro

reviews.text: [Fassbender's] performance elevates the film: a multi-faceted reboot of the requisite android.
reviews.author: Ian Nathan

reviews.text: Not as frightening as Alien, not as thrilling as Aliens, but a 3D sci-fi blockbuster that's easily the saga's most spectacular entry.
reviews.author: Jonathan Crocker

reviews.text: The best film of the summer so far.
reviews.author: David Poland

reviews.text: Prometheus is a great ride - best taken without too much foreknowledge, by the way.
reviews.author: David Sexton

reviews.text: Not only does Prometheus herald the rebirth of Alien, it breaths life back into intelligent sci-fi.
reviews.author: Grant Rollings

reviews.text: Remains earthbound in narrative terms, forever hinting at the existence of a higher intelligence without evincing much of its own.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: It's something to gorge on hungrily all the same: majestic to look at in every way, and wild enough that many of the opening-night crowd -- this viewer included -- will be right back for seconds.
reviews.author: Tim Robey

reviews.text: Ridley Scott has counter-evolved his 1979 classic Alien into something more grandiose, more elaborate - but less interesting.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Should thrill, challenge and provoke audiences ready for [Scott's] signature brand of intelligent and visceral film-making.
reviews.author: Mark Adams

reviews.text: It does supply enough visual spectacle, tense action and sticky, slithery monster attacks to hit the spot with thrill-seeking audiences worldwide.
reviews.author: Todd McCarthy

synopsis: The discovery of a clue to mankind's origins on Earth leads a team of explorers to the darkest parts of the universe. Two brilliant young scientists lead the expedition. Shaw (Noomi Rapace) hopes that they will meet a race of benevolent, godlike beings who will in some way verify her religious beliefs, while Holloway (Logan Marshall-Green) is out to debunk any spiritual notions. However, neither the scientists nor their shipmates are prepared for the unimaginable terrors that await them.
